definition: to come to oneself/to come to realize/to come to see the truth/to wake up to reality
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to
to comprehend/to apprehend/to become aware
a sudden realization/to realize sth in a flash

sentences.english: Until last hurt, I will not awake?
sentences.chinese: 直到最後的傷害，我才肯醒悟嗎？

sentences.english: Cuiping finally realized her act and took the pipe and went out bare foot to the balcony.
sentences.chinese: 倒是翠平猛然醒悟過來，拎着菸袋光着腳跑到陽臺上。

sentences.english: When the penny drops like this, there are only two possible outcomes.
sentences.chinese: 當年輕人幡然醒悟時，只有兩種可能的後果。

sentences.english: You're infatuated with her now, but the scales will soon fall form your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 你現在還迷戀着她，但不久就會猛然醒悟過來的。

sentences.english: The necessity of making a living disentranced him from his gamble.
sentences.chinese: 謀生的必要使他醒悟，不再賭博了。

sentences.english: This one could be a prelude to the anger and disillusionment that is only beginning to swell.
sentences.chinese: 這可能就是剛剛開始膨脹的憤怒和醒悟的前奏。

sentences.english: At last it dawned on me that these obstacles were my life. "------Alfred D'Souza."
sentences.chinese: 可到最後我翻然醒悟，這些障礙物就是我的生活。

sentences.english: The harshness of recent reality disentranced him from his idleness.
sentences.chinese: 最近的嚴酷現實使他醒悟，不再遊手好閒了。

sentences.english: Now I began to understand: As a writer, I was also an activist.
sentences.chinese: 如今我開始醒悟，作爲一名作家，也可以積極參與。

sentences.english: Truth enlightens the mind, but won't always bring happiness to your heart.
sentences.chinese: 真相使人醒悟，卻未必使人快樂。

sentences.english: After a long journey, he finally wakes up to the reality of life.
sentences.chinese: 一番長途旅行後，牠終於醒悟到生活的現實面。

sentences.english: I misunderstood the south west chicken awakening.
sentences.chinese: 西鳳醒悟本人誤解向南了。

sentences.english: But by the next morning, Cassandra had come around.
sentences.chinese: 但是到了第二天早上，卡桑德醒悟了過來。

sentences.english: Dad, you have just worded a profound change in my personality.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，你剛纔這番話發人深思，使我幡然醒悟。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, they awake to the break of happiness, the betrayal of connubial .
sentences.chinese: 同一刻，他們醒悟到幸福的破裂，配偶的背叛。

sentences.english: Fake and low-quality products have disillusioned customers in China.
sentences.chinese: 假冒僞劣商品使中國的消費者飽受其害，並最終醒悟。

definition: to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
suddenly (understand sth)/in a flash
to suddenly realize/to suddenly see the light
suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)
to realize suddenly/to wake up to the truth/to suddenly awake from sleep
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to collect one's thoughts (after being surprised or shocked)/to snap out of it (after being lost in thought)
to figure out/to realize/to become convinced/to come round (to an idea)/to get over it
clear-headed/sober/awake
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
stunned/amazed
to stun/to shock and amaze/stupefied/astonishment
relieved/at ease/feel relieved
to forget one's manners/to forget oneself/to lose self-control (in a situation)
to stop/to pull back
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
